a52dec.description: Decodes ATSC A/52 encoded audio streams

a52dec.author: David I. Lehn <dlehn@users.sourceforge.net>
a52dec.description: Decodes ATSC A/52 encoded audio streams
a52dec.name: a52dec

src.caps:
audio/x-raw:
         format: F32LE
         layout: interleaved
           rate: [ 4000, 96000 ]
       channels: [ 1, 6 ]

min-latency.blurb: Aggregate output data to a minimum of latency time (ns)

tolerance.blurb: Perfect ts while timestamp jitter/imperfection within tolerance (ns)

src.caps:
audio/x-raw:
         format: S16LE
         layout: interleaved
           rate: 8000
       channels: 1

min-latency.blurb: Aggregate output data to a minimum of latency time (ns)

tolerance.blurb: Perfect ts while timestamp jitter/imperfection within tolerance (ns)

sink.caps:
audio/x-raw:
         format: S16LE
         layout: interleaved
           rate: 8000
       channels: 1

hard-resync.blurb: Perform clipping and sample flushing upon discontinuity

mark-granule.blurb: Apply granule semantics to buffer metadata (implies perfect-timestamp)

perfect-timestamp.blurb: Favour perfect timestamps over tracking upstream timestamps

tolerance.blurb: Consider discontinuity if timestamp jitter/imperfection exceeds tolerance (ns)

src.caps:
audio/x-raw:
         format: S16LE
         layout: interleaved
           rate: 16000
       channels: 1

min-latency.blurb: Aggregate output data to a minimum of latency time (ns)

tolerance.blurb: Perfect ts while timestamp jitter/imperfection within tolerance (ns)

asf.description: Demuxes and muxes audio and video in Microsofts ASF format

rtpasfdepay.author: Tim-Philipp Müller <tim centricular net>, Wim Taymans <wim.taymans@gmail.com>
rtpasfdepay.name: rtpasfdepay

sink.caps:
application/x-rtp:
          media: { (string)application, (string)video, (string)audio }
        payload: [ 96, 127 ]
     clock-rate: [ 1, 2147483647 ]
  encoding-name: X-ASF-PF

source-info.blurb: Add RTP source information as buffer meta

stats.default: application/x-rtp-depayload-stats, clock_rate=(uint)0, npt-start=(guint64)0, npt-stop=(guint64)18446744073709551615, play-speed=(double)1, play-scale=(double)1, running-time-dts=(guint64)18446744073709551615, running-time-pts=(guint64)18446744073709551615, seqnum=(uint)0, timestamp=(uint)0;

rtspwms.author: Wim Taymans <wim.taymans@gmail.com>
rtspwms.description: Extends RTSP so that it can handle WMS setup
rtspwms.name: rtspwms

cdiocddasrc.author: Tim-Philipp Müller <tim centricular net>
cdiocddasrc.description: Read audio from CD using libcdio
cdiocddasrc.name: cdiocddasrc

src.caps:
audio/x-raw:
         format: S16LE
         layout: interleaved
           rate: 44100
       channels: 2

blocksize.blurb: Size in bytes to read per buffer (-1 = default)

do-timestamp.blurb: Apply current stream time to buffers

num-buffers.blurb: Number of buffers to output before sending EOS (-1 = unlimited)

read-speed.blurb: Read from device at the specified speed (-1 = default)

dvdlpcmdec.description: Decode DVD LPCM frames into standard PCM

dvdlpcmdec.author: Jan Schmidt <jan@noraisin.net>, Michael Smith <msmith@fluendo.com>
dvdlpcmdec.description: Decode DVD LPCM frames into standard PCM audio
dvdlpcmdec.name: dvdlpcmdec

min-latency.blurb: Aggregate output data to a minimum of latency time (ns)

tolerance.blurb: Perfect ts while timestamp jitter/imperfection within tolerance (ns)

dvdreadsrc.author: Erik Walthinsen <omega@cse.ogi.edu>
dvdreadsrc.description: Access a DVD title/chapter/angle using libdvdread
dvdreadsrc.name: dvdreadsrc

blocksize.blurb: Size in bytes to read per buffer (-1 = default)

do-timestamp.blurb: Apply current stream time to buffers

num-buffers.blurb: Number of buffers to output before sending EOS (-1 = unlimited)

dvdsubdec.author: Wim Taymans <wim.taymans@gmail.com>, Jan Schmidt <thaytan@mad.scientist.com>
dvdsubdec.description: Decodes DVD subtitles into AYUV video frames
dvdsubdec.name: dvdsubdec

src.caps:
video/x-raw:
         format: { AYUV, ARGB }
          width: 720
         height: 576
      framerate: 0/1

dvdsubparse.author: Mark Nauwelaerts <mnauw@users.sourceforge.net>
dvdsubparse.description: Parses and packetizes DVD subtitle streams
dvdsubparse.name: dvdsubparse

mpeg2dec.author: Wim Taymans <wim.taymans@chello.be>
mpeg2dec.description: Uses libmpeg2 to decode MPEG video streams
mpeg2dec.name: mpeg2dec

src.caps:
video/x-raw:
         format: { YV12, I420, Y42B, Y444 }
          width: [ 16, 4096 ]
         height: [ 16, 4096 ]
      framerate: [ 0/1, 2147483647/1 ]

pnmsrc.author: Wim Taymans <wim.taymans@gmail.com>
pnmsrc.description: Receive data over the network via PNM
pnmsrc.name: pnmsrc

blocksize.blurb: Size in bytes to read per buffer (-1 = default)

do-timestamp.blurb: Apply current stream time to buffers

location.blurb: Location of the PNM url to read

num-buffers.blurb: Number of buffers to output before sending EOS (-1 = unlimited)

rdtdepay.author: Lutz Mueller <lutz at topfrose dot de>, Wim Taymans <wim@fluendo.com>
rdtdepay.name: rdtdepay

sink.caps:
application/x-rdt:
          media: application
     clock-rate: [ 1, 2147483647 ]
  encoding-name: X-REAL-RDT

rdtmanager.author: Wim Taymans <wim.taymans@gmail.com>
rdtmanager.description: Accepts raw RTP and RTCP packets and sends them forward
rdtmanager.name: rdtmanager

rmdemux.author: David Schleef <ds@schleef.org>
rmdemux.description: Demultiplex a RealMedia file into audio and video streams
rmdemux.name: rmdemux

rtspreal.author: Wim Taymans <wim.taymans@gmail.com>
rtspreal.description: Extends RTSP so that it can handle RealMedia setup
rtspreal.name: rtspreal

siddec.author: Wim Taymans <wim.taymans@gmail.com>
siddec.description: Use libsidplay to decode SID audio tunes
siddec.name: siddec

src.caps:
audio/x-raw:
         format: { S16LE, U16LE, S8, U8 }
         layout: interleaved
           rate: [ 8000, 48000 ]
       channels: [ 1, 2 ]

blocksize.blurb: Size in bytes to output per buffer

src.caps:
video/x-h264:
      framerate: [ 0/1, 2147483647/1 ]
          width: [ 1, 2147483647 ]
         height: [ 1, 2147483647 ]
  stream-format: { (string)avc, (string)byte-stream }
      alignment: au
        profile: { (string)high-4:4:4, (string)high-4:2:2, (string)high-10, (string)high, (string)main, (string)baseline, (string)constrained-baseline, (string)high-4:4:4-intra, (string)high-4:2:2-intra, (string)high-10-intra }

b-adapt.blurb: Automatically decide how many B-frames to use

bframes.blurb: Number of B-frames between I and P

byte-stream.blurb: Generate byte stream format of NALU

frame-packing.blurb: Set frame packing mode for Stereoscopic content

values.desc: checkerboard - Left and Right pixels alternate in a checkerboard pattern
values.name: checkerboard

values.desc: column interleaved - Alternating pixel columns represent Left and Right views
values.name: column-interleaved

values.desc: row interleaved - Alternating pixel rows represent Left and Right views
values.name: row-interleaved

values.desc: side by side - The left half of the frame contains the Left eye view, the right half the Right eye view
values.name: side-by-side

values.desc: top bottom - L is on top, R on bottom
values.name: top-bottom

values.desc: frame interleaved - Each frame contains either Left or Right view alternately
values.name: frame-interleaved

intra-refresh.blurb: Use Periodic Intra Refresh instead of IDR frames

ip-factor.blurb: Quantizer factor between I- and P-frames

key-int-max.blurb: Maximal distance between two key-frames (0 for automatic)

option-string.blurb: String of x264 options (overridden by element properties) in the format "key1=value1:key2=value2".

pb-factor.blurb: Quantizer factor between P- and B-frames

psy-tune.blurb: Preset name for psychovisual tuning options

quantizer.blurb: Constant quantizer or quality to apply

rc-lookahead.blurb: Number of frames for frametype lookahead

sliced-threads.blurb: Low latency but lower efficiency threading

speed-preset.blurb: Preset name for speed/quality tradeoff options (can affect decode compatibility - impose restrictions separately for your target decoder)

subme.blurb: Subpixel motion estimation and partition decision quality: 1=fast, 10=best

sync-lookahead.blurb: Number of buffer frames for threaded lookahead (-1 for automatic)

threads.blurb: Number of threads used by the codec (0 for automatic)

tune.blurb: Preset name for non-psychovisual tuning options

vbv-buf-capacity.blurb: Size of the VBV buffer in milliseconds

xingmux.description: Add XING tags to mpeg audio files

xingmux.author: Christophe Fergeau <teuf@gnome.org>
xingmux.description: Adds a Xing header to the beginning of a VBR MP3 file
xingmux.name: xingmux
